statements: UPDATE KPIs SET kpi_value = 100.50 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE KPIs SET kpi_name = 'New KPI Name' WHERE department_id = 2;
UPDATE KPIs SET date_updated = NOW() WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE KPIs SET kpi_value = kpi_value + 100 WHERE department_id = 1;
UPDATE KPIs SET kpi_value = kpi_value - 50 WHERE department_id = 2;
UPDATE KPIs SET kpi_value = kpi_value * 1.1 WHERE department_id = 3;
UPDATE KPI_Data SET metric1 = 100 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE KPI_Data SET metric2 = 75 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE KPI_Config SET weight = 0.5 WHERE config_id = 1;
UPDATE KPI_Data SET metric1 = metric1 * 1.2 WHERE date > '2022-01-01';
UPDATE KPI_Config SET metric_name = 'New Metric Name' WHERE config_id = 3;
UPDATE KPI_Data SET metric1 = 0.9 * metric1, metric2 = 0.8 * metric2 WHERE date < '2022-03-01';
UPDATE kpi_metrics SET value = 100.50 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE kpi_categories SET description = 'New Description' WHERE category_id = 2;
UPDATE kpi_data SET data_value = 75.25 WHERE data_id = 3;
UPDATE kpi_metrics SET value = value + 100 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE kpi_categories SET description = 'New Category Description' WHERE category_id = 2;
UPDATE kpi_data SET data_value = data_value * 1.1, timestamp = NOW() WHERE metric_id = 1 AND category_id = 2;
UPDATE users SET age = 30 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE products SET price = 19.99 WHERE product_id = 101;
UPDATE orders SET quantity = 3 WHERE order_id = 201;
UPDATE users SET age = age + 1 WHERE gender = 'Male';
UPDATE orders SET quantity = quantity - 1 WHERE order_date < '2022-01-01';
UPDATE products SET price = price * 0.9 WHERE category = 'Electronics';
UPDATE Users SET user_name = 'John Doe' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE Products SET price = 29.99 WHERE product_id = 101;
UPDATE Sales SET quantity = 5, sale_amount = 149.95 WHERE sale_id = 201;
UPDATE Users SET user_name = 'John Doe' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE Orders SET total_amount = total_amount * 1.1 WHERE order_date >= '2022-01-01';
UPDATE Products SET price = price * 1.05 WHERE category = 'Electronics';
